alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued August 25 at 6:37PM ChST until August 27 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO 6 PM CHST SUNDAY ALONG SOUTH AND WEST FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS FROM 6 AM CHST SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON ALONG SOUTH AND WEST FACING REEFS... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 8 to 10 feet and dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...South and west facing reefs of the Marianas. * WHEN...From 6 AM Saturday to 6 PM ChST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
